title: Unable to create Euclid Flex Thin font

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
The `SKTypeface.FromFamilyName()` requires that the font be installed to the system (C:\Windows\Fonts)

If you don't have permissions or can't install, then reading from a stream is just fine. There are other options to load without copying:
 - `SKTypeface.FromFile`
 - `SKTypeface.FromStream`

comments.author: VijayRM
comments.body: Yes this font was already installed.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
It might be because you are querying the font weight as `SKFontStyleWeight.Thin` or using `SKFontStyleWidth.Normal`.

I think this is a duplicate of #682

comments.author: VijayRM
comments.body: SKFontStyleWeight.Light is working for the same font. So, this issue occurs only for SKFontStyleWeight.Thin. Whether it is a known bug of SkiaSharp?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I'm closing this now because it is a duplicate of #682. Not a bug per se, but definitely a known limitation. This is something we can address in the upcoming v2 of the library.

I'll update the other issue with progress, so it might be good to subscribe to that one.
